intro: Galium shikokianum, commonly known as Shikoku bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture. Galium shikokianum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
